channel.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
channel.description: Ive already read a username and password but i want it to read like str and hp and all those stats (not a RSPS) and print that out in a textbox or label, then the user or admin can write it to what ever they want and save it.

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

USERNAME PASSWORD STR INT CHA DEX ADMIN
master master 5 4 3 2 1

Ok now it logs in, grabs that info ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

And prints it to a certain object making it editable and then saveable.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Mod Val, post:17, topic:351279”]Lin I looked at the code you provided, and that’s not what I need thats just like what Ive already done. That’s logging in not grabbing the information. I always gotta describe in detail.

USERNAME PASSWORD STR INT CHA DEX ADMIN
master master 5 4 3 2 1

Ok now it logs in, grabs that info ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

And prints it to a certain object making it editable and then saveable.[/quote]The code I provided was not for logging in… It was splitting a string by the = sign so you could write what you wanted to the table. The page I linked to showed other MySQL stuff.

Read full topic

easy coded solution.

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

No no… The code im use to looks like this:

[code]Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
MysqlConnection = New MySqlConnection()
MysqlConnection.ConnectionString = “server=localhost; user id=root; password=; database=eft;”
Try
MysqlConnection.Open()
MsgBox(“Connectioned to Database!”, MsgBoxStyle.Exclamation, “Connnected”)
Catch myerror As MySqlException
MessageBox.Show(“Connection to Database failed!” & myerror.Message, “Error”)
End Try
Dim myadapter As New MySqlDataAdapter
Dim sqlquery = “SELECT * FROM users WHERE Username = '” & TextBox1.Text & “’ AND Password = '” & TextBox2.Text & “’;”
Dim command As New MySqlCommand
command.Connection = MysqlConnection
command.CommandText = sqlquery
myadapter.SelectCommand = command
Dim mydata As MySqlDataReader
mydata = command.ExecuteReader()
If mydata.HasRows = 0 Then
MsgBox(“Invailed Username or Password.”, MsgBoxStyle.Critical, “Error”)
Else

    End If
End Sub[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Mod Val, post:10, topic:351279”][quote author=Lin link=topic=447639.msg3285319#msg3285319 date=1280168378]
http://www.vbmysql.com/articles/vbnet-mysql-tutorials/the-vbnet-mysql-tutorial-part-3

I’d suggest using a ListBox for the display of each item with the format of “var=val” and this way, when you want to write, to get the variable you do listBox.SelectedItem.Split(’=’)[0], and for the value, change the 0 to 1.
[/quote]
This isn’t code im use to, im using vb 2008 express.[/quote]So change the [0] to (0)…

Read full topic

[/quote]
This isn’t code im use to, im using vb 2008 express.[/quote]

God I hate VB.

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

http://www.vbmysql.com/articles/vbnet-mysql-tutorials/the-vbnet-mysql-tutorial-part-3

I’d suggest using a ListBox for the display of each item with the format of “var=val” and this way, when you want to write, to get the variable you do listBox.SelectedItem.Split(’=’)[0], and for the value, change the 0 to 1.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP]Visual Basic 2008 Reading from MySQL
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Mod Val, post:5, topic:351279”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=447639.msg3285306#msg3285306 date=1280167745]

So basically you want us to spoon-feed this to you so you? I don’t think so. Look up MySQL tutorials for VB .NET on Google and string manipulation.

No spoon-feed thanks snob … I just need to know the correct code, Ive tried many things nothing has seemed to work right.

Why is it harder to read the stats than it is to read the username? What are you programing here?
[/quote]

Ah because my knowlage isn’t enough to know hot to take the MySQL information and transfer it to a label or textbox. Im making a program for another emulation for users to easily edit their characters.[/quote]

Gotcha, so all you need is to pull information FROM the sql server?

Read full topic
